gcci.text: H100s remain supply‑constrained and capital‑intensive at roughly $3.16/hr, keeping capex elevated and driving tighter availability despite incremental capacity.

gtpi.text: Average input tokens at ~$1.25/M signal intensifying API price wars, compressing margins and favoring efficient, higher‑throughput models in competitive markets.

gagl.text: AI’s ~120 TWh annual load stresses grids and accelerates interest in nuclear baseload and firm renewables to cut carbon intensity.

aipi.text: With token prices falling but compute prices high, funding must favor efficiency and moats to sustain growth and avoid a usage‑bubble unwind.
